intro: Wikstroemia indica, commonly known as the Indian snowbell, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
